metadata.description: ing customer details and transfer rules.

hosts.name: Newfeaturemaster
hosts.description: Development environment where new features are developed and initially tested.

hosts.name: Deployment
hosts.description: QA environment for thorough testing of features before production deployment.

hosts.name: Production
hosts.description: Production environment where features are live and available to end-users.

allowed_transfers.description: Transfer from Development to QA for further testing.
Transfer from QA to Production for live deployment.
Roll back from Production to Development for addressing issues.

disallowed_transfers.description: Direct transfer from Development to Production is not allowed to maintain stability.
Direct transfer from Production to QA is not allowed to prevent overwriting QA data.
Direct transfer from QA to Development is not allowed to maintain data integrity.

allowed_rollbacks.description: Rollback from QA to Development to address testing feedback.
Rollback from Production to QA to fix issues identified in the live environment.

disallowed_rollbacks.description: Rollback from Production to Development is not allowed to prevent data inconsistency.

process_descriptions.name: Development to QA
process_descriptions.description: This step involves transferring data from the Development environment to the QA environment. Pre-transfer validation is performed using a script to ensure data integrity before initiating the transfer. In QA, features undergo rigorous testing including functional, integration, and system testing to ensure quality standards before moving to production.

related_processes.name: QA to Development
related_processes.description: Rollback from QA to Development to address any issues identified during QA testing.

process_descriptions.name: QA to Production
process_descriptions.description: Once features have passed all QA tests and post-transfer verification confirms data integrity, they are transferred to the Production environment. This step is critical as the features become live for end-users. Any issues detected in production can be rolled back to QA for resolution.

related_processes.name: Production to QA
related_processes.description: Rollback from Production to QA to resolve any issues detected in the live environment.

process_descriptions.name: Production to Development
process_descriptions.description: In case features need revision based on production feedback, they are transferred back to Development. This ensures that any issues or required enhancements are addressed in a controlled environment before potentially redeploying to QA or Production. Post-transfer verification ensures data consistency.

related_processes.name: Development to Production
related_processes.description: Rollback from Development to Production is not permitted to prevent data inconsistencies.

process_descriptions.name: QA to Development
process_descriptions.description: Rollback from QA to Development to address any issues identified during QA testing.

process_descriptions.name: Production to QA
process_descriptions.description: Rollback from Production to QA to resolve any issues detected in the live environment.

process_descriptions.name: Development to Production
process_descriptions.description: Rollback from Development to Production is not permitted to prevent data inconsistencies.

release_stages.description: Initial stage where new features and fixes are developed and unit tested.
QA stage for comprehensive testing including functional, integration, and system testing.
Optional stage for final testing in an environment closely mirroring production.
Final stage where features are live and available to end-users.
